greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = g_n(4), where g is the weak Goodstein function defined in A266202.
comment: For more info see A266201 - A266202.
mathematica: g[k_, n_] := If[k == 0, n, Total@ Flatten@ MapIndexed[#1 (k + 2)^(#2 - 1) &, Reverse@ IntegerDigits[#, k + 1]] &@ g[k - 1, n] - 1]; Table[g[n, 4], {n, 0, 21}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 18 2016 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {if (n == 0, return (4)); wn = 4; for (k=2, n+1, pd = Pol(digits(wn, k)); wn = subst(pd, x, k+1) - 1; ); wn; }
vector(22, n, n--; a(n)) \\ _Michel Marcus_, Apr 03 2016
xref: Weak Goodstein sequences: A137411: g_n(11); A265034: g_n(266); A266202: g_n(n); A267648: g_5(n); A266203: a(n) = k such that g_k(n)=0;
results.author: _Natan Arie Consigli_, Mar 17 2016
